Comments_List: I practiced investigation and original research.
This was a truly formative experience. It was equal parts demanding and fulfilling. I was lucky enough to have a great adviser, Naysan Adlparvar, who supported me every step of the way.
I learned to work independently on a research project, and manage my own time in terms of reading and writing a longer paper
In depth knowledge of carbon accounting, natural resource economics, and forestry financials.
Practiced research, self-motivation, proactivity, accessible academic writing.
There could be more support helping students find advisors. This was the most difficult part of writing my thesis.

I think that the deadlines for a spring thesis are quite difficult to meet, especially considering the length of the EP&E essay. I would recommend that the program encourage seniors to take a senior seminar or directed reading in the fall of their senior year, so that they can start thinking and planning their senior essay. I think this would make the research much more in depth, without necessarily requiring students to enroll in a two semester thesis
self guided course, Gautam offered great support. Nothing stands out as needing improving.
It's required to graduate, so yes.
Writing my thesis has been one of the highlights of my academic career as an undergrad. I enjoyed this class so much, and really got a lot out of it.
Yes, find a great project and professor and devote to an independent project. there's no other opportunity like it.
